elemental_convection.summary: Early mana efficiency for shocks and other spells. Mostly a filler or a support pick for shock heavy Enhancement variants.
why_take: Helps reduce shock mana pressure when you are actively shocking as part of your damage plan.
Often used as a clean filler to reach the specific Elemental tier where your real target talents live.
why_skip: If you are not shocking much, the value is mostly invisible.
If points are tight, you usually prioritize direct damage multipliers like Concussion and cadence tools like Reverberation first.
tips: This shines most on longer fights where you would otherwise be forced to skip shocks due to mana.

rank_notes.1: Even one point can smooth early mana if you shock frequently.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is usually only taken when you are intentionally committing to more Elemental filler.

common_mistakes: Taking this while also playing a low shock style, then wondering why the build feels unchanged.

elemental_concussion.summary: Straight shock damage multiplier. Common in sub Elemental Enhancement builds.
why_take: Directly increases your shock damage, which is a meaningful slice of Enhancement output in shock forward play.
Simple and reliable value per point with no rotation complexity.
why_skip: If your build is minimizing shocks due to mana, mechanics, or pacing, this loses value.
If you are forced to cut Elemental points to reach more core Enhancement throughput, this is often where you start trimming.
tips: If you plan an EP section, call out that shock multipliers effectively raise the value of spell power and spell crit for your shocks.

rank_notes.1: The first point is immediately relevant if you shock at all.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is typical when the build is explicitly shock focused.

elemental_earths_grasp.summary: Control utility for Earthbind. Valuable in PvP and niche movement control, not a standard raid DPS pick.
why_take: Useful when you value control and kiting tools more than throughput, mainly in PvP or specific leveling routes.
Can be relevant in certain solo scenarios where you must manage multiple enemies.
why_skip: For Enhancement raid DPS, these points do not increase your damage or your raid contribution in a consistent way.
Every point here delays or prevents key Enhancement payoffs deeper in the tree.
tips: If you include PvP callouts, label this clearly as a control talent, not a damage talent.

rank_notes.1: A small investment can still change the feel of your control tools.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is mainly for players intentionally optimizing control.

elemental_elemental_warding.summary: Elemental damage reduction. A defensive layer that can matter on progression, but competes with damage points.
why_take: If you are dying to elemental damage and it is limiting your uptime, defense can become a damage increase indirectly.
Useful in PvP where survivability often outranks small throughput gains.
why_skip: Enhancement generally gets more value from damage and consistency talents than from passive mitigation.
Deepening into Elemental for defense usually costs major Enhancement power such as Unleashed Rage or Shamanistic Rage.
tips: Only consider defensive talents when deaths are frequent enough to reduce your time on target.

rank_notes.1: A first point can be a reasonable compromise when you want a small defensive buffer.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a deliberate defensive commitment.

elemental_call_of_flame.summary: Fire totem amplifier. Used in fire totem focused Enhancement variations.
why_take: If your fire totem contributes meaningful damage in the content you are doing, this is direct scaling.
Often chosen when you want more personal fire throughput rather than leaning into weapon totem specialization.
why_skip: If your fire totem uptime is low due to movement, target swaps, or frequent repositioning, value drops sharply.
If your plan is not fire focused, these points are usually weaker than shock cadence or core Enhancement points.
tips: Fire totem value is extremely uptime sensitive. Teach players to think in uptime, not tooltip.

rank_notes.1: A small investment can be worthwhile if your fire totem already has high uptime.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is best when your build identity is clearly fire focused.

elemental_elemental_focus.summary: Clearcasting style proc for spell efficiency. Can support shock heavy Enhancement, but rarely beats other Elemental options point for point.
why_take: Can reduce mana strain when you are shocking regularly and want longer rotation stability.
Has practical value in very long encounters where small efficiency compounds.
why_skip: Requires getting to its tier, which often means taking filler you would not otherwise want.
If you are not casting spells frequently, the proc rate and impact are limited.
tips: This is better framed as a rotation stability talent, not a raw damage talent.

rank_notes.1: One point is all you need if you are taking it at all.

elemental_reverberation.summary: Shock cadence control. Enables more shocks over time when shocks are part of your plan.
why_take: Lets you shock more often, which increases damage when mana and timing allow.
Pairs well with any setup labeled shock focused, especially when your play emphasizes consistent shock usage.
why_skip: If shocks are infrequent due to mana, mechanics, or a deliberate low shock style, reduced cooldown does not translate into real value.
If you are cutting Elemental points to protect deep Enhancement power, this is a common trim.
tips: More shocks is only good if you can afford the mana and the timing does not disrupt swing planning.

rank_notes.1: Early points matter because they change how often you can choose to shock.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a signature of true shock forward builds.

common_mistakes: Taking max Reverberation, then playing too conservatively to actually use the extra shock windows.

elemental_call_of_thunder.summary: Caster crit support. Not a typical Enhancement investment because Enhancement does not rely on Lightning Bolt casting for damage.
why_take: Only taken in extremely niche hybrid concepts or PvP variations where you intentionally emphasize caster bursts.
why_skip: Enhancement damage in raids is primarily weapon and melee event driven, not Lightning Bolt driven.
Going this deep into Elemental usually costs critical Enhancement talents and raid value.
tips: If you include this in your guide, mark it clearly as not part of standard Enhancement talent packages.

rank_notes.1: If you take it, you typically commit fully because partial value is low compared to the opportunity cost.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a deep Elemental commitment and not an Enhancement default.

elemental_improved_fire_totems.summary: Fire totem throughput amplifier. Common in fire totem focused Enhancement variants.
why_take: Directly increases the damage value of your fire totems when they have high uptime.
Often paired with Call of Flame to define a fire oriented sub Elemental package.
why_skip: If your fire totems are frequently interrupted by movement or mechanics, the real gain is small.
If you must reduce Elemental investment to keep deep Enhancement power, fire totem talents are often the first cuts.
tips: Teach players to evaluate fire totem talents using estimated uptime for the content they run.

rank_notes.1: A single point is sometimes used as a small bump in mixed packages.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is best when fire totems are a meaningful portion of your fight time.

elemental_eye_of_the_storm.summary: Caster stability after taking damage. Mostly PvP and caster utility, not Enhancement raid DPS.
why_take: Relevant when you are intentionally playing a caster heavy style where pushback is a real limiter.
Can matter in PvP where you are under constant pressure.
why_skip: Enhancement rarely relies on cast time spells as its main damage engine in raids.
Deeper Elemental defensive utility costs core Enhancement throughput.
tips: This is best labeled as a caster quality talent, not a hybrid throughput talent.

rank_notes.1: Small investment can be enough if you are only trying to reduce frustration.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a dedicated caster oriented choice.

elemental_elemental_devastation.summary: Spell crit to melee crit conversion window. Conceptually attractive for shock builds, but usually too deep and too inconsistent for standard Enhancement.
why_take: If you are building a shock crit centric concept and you can reliably trigger it, the payoff can be noticeable.
why_skip: This is deep Elemental investment that competes directly with key Enhancement talents that define raid value and consistency.
Shock crit frequency can be inconsistent without heavy support, which makes the window unreliable.
tips: If you include it, explain it as a high variance talent that can look great in spikes but underperform in consistent parses.

rank_notes.1: One point is all you need if you take it at all.

common_mistakes: Assuming this is a standard Enhancement path because it mentions melee crit, then losing Unleashed Rage or Shamanistic Rage to reach it.

elemental_storm_reach.summary: Range extension for lightning spells. Primarily a caster convenience talent, not Enhancement throughput.
why_take: Only taken for niche utility or PvP positioning where range constraints matter for your spell usage.
why_skip: Enhancement raid damage is not limited by lightning spell range.
Points spent here delay or prevent deeper Enhancement payoffs.
tips: If you include this, position it as convenience and utility, not damage.

rank_notes.1: A small investment can solve a specific annoyance.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is a deliberate utility choice.

elemental_elemental_fury.summary: Spell crit damage amplifier. Strong for Elemental caster, weak for Enhancement because Enhancement is not built around spell crit damage.
why_take: Only taken in caster oriented builds where your spell crit damage is a core output driver.
why_skip: Enhancement gains more from melee scaling and swing event consistency than from increasing spell crit damage.
Reaching this tier costs too many points that should be in Enhancement for raid DPS.
tips: If you are documenting sub spec options, this is beyond the normal Enhancement sub Elemental range.

rank_notes.1: One point is a large commitment because of depth, even if the talent itself is one point.

elemental_unrelenting_storm.summary: Mana sustain tied to intellect and casting. Primarily for Elemental caster, not a core Enhancement need.
why_take: Only if your concept is extremely mana constrained and you are also investing in intellect and spell usage.
why_skip: Enhancement typically solves mana through Shamanistic Rage and good shock discipline, not deep Elemental regen.
This depth costs major Enhancement talents that provide both personal and raid value.
tips: Frame this as a caster sustain lever rather than an Enhancement solution.

rank_notes.1: Early points are low impact without meaningful intellect and cast time usage.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a caster commitment, not an Enhancement default.

elemental_elemental_precision.summary: Spell hit and efficiency style support. Can stabilize shock consistency, but usually too deep compared to sub resto hit options.
why_take: If you are missing shocks or other spells and you want more consistency, extra spell hit can help.
Can be used in niche packages where you are already deep in Elemental for other reasons.
why_skip: For Enhancement, hit consistency is often handled via gear planning and sub resto Nature's Guidance rather than deep Elemental investment.
The opportunity cost is usually too high compared to deep Enhancement talents.
tips: Teach the difference between melee hit needs and spell hit needs, and clarify what this actually supports.

rank_notes.1: A first point can help if you are specifically missing spells.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a deep commitment and rarely an Enhancement default.

elemental_lightning_mastery.summary: Caster cast time improvement. Not a standard Enhancement investment.
why_take: Only taken in caster centric builds or PvP hybrids where lightning casts are part of your kill plan.
why_skip: Enhancement raid DPS does not revolve around repeated cast time lightning spells.
Depth requirement conflicts with core Enhancement throughput and raid buffs.
tips: Label as caster only in an Enhancement guide.

rank_notes.1: Value depends entirely on how often you cast lightning spells.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a caster identity choice.

elemental_elemental_mastery.summary: Caster burst control. Not an Enhancement talent package choice for raids.
why_take: PvP burst setups or caster hybrids that want controlled spell crit windows.
why_skip: Too deep for Enhancement and does not support the core weapon based damage plan.
Costs key Enhancement raid value such as Unleashed Rage.
tips: If shown at all, place under a PvP or hybrid appendix.

rank_notes.1: One point only, but the depth is the real cost.

elemental_elemental_shields.summary: Lightning Shield focus. Can be a small passive damage or utility piece, but rarely worth deep Elemental points for Enhancement.
why_take: If you are already deep and want to squeeze extra passive value from Lightning Shield usage.
In PvP, improved shield effects can matter for pressure.
why_skip: Enhancement generally gets better returns from direct melee scaling talents.
If you are investing this deep, you are sacrificing major Enhancement payoffs.
tips: If you want a Lightning Shield themed package for Enhancement, compare this against Improved Lightning Shield in the Enhancement tree first.

rank_notes.1: First points are minor unless Lightning Shield uptime is extremely high.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a niche commitment.

elemental_lightning_overload.summary: Caster proc talent for lightning spells. Not a typical Enhancement investment.
why_take: Only for Elemental caster builds where lightning spam is central.
why_skip: Enhancement does not generate enough lightning casts for this to be a strong use of points.
Depth competes with essential Enhancement talents.
tips: In an Enhancement guide, treat this as out of scope except for completeness.

rank_notes.1: Value grows with cast frequency, which Enhancement typically does not have.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is caster only.

elemental_totem_of_wrath.summary: Deep Elemental raid support totem. Not compatible with standard Enhancement talent priorities.
why_take: Only if you are intentionally playing as an Elemental support style rather than Enhancement DPS.
why_skip: Depth makes it incompatible with core Enhancement tools and raid value packages.
If you want Enhancement raid value, your priority is Unleashed Rage and consistent melee throughput.
tips: Call out clearly that this is not an Enhancement DPS endpoint.

rank_notes.1: One point only, but the depth defines the build.

enhancement_ancestral_knowledge.summary: Intellect scaling for mana and spell based components. Common early filler that supports rotation stability.
why_take: More intellect supports longer fight mana stability and helps support shock usage.
Pairs naturally with Mental Quickness style scaling where your attack power fuels spell damage components.
why_skip: If you are building a very specialized setup and points are extremely tight, you may trim filler to reach key thresholds elsewhere.
tips: When players complain about mana, this is one of the early places that can help without changing playstyle.

rank_notes.1: Early points are noticeable while gearing up.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is common because it is a clean early value path.

enhancement_shield_specialization.summary: Shield and block focused defensive talent. Not part of standard dual wield Enhancement DPS.
why_take: Taken for tanking, solo survivability, or PvP defensive setups that prioritize shield usage.
why_skip: Enhancement raid DPS typically uses dual wield and gains little from shield specific defense points.
Points here compete with direct damage and raid value talents.
tips: If you add off spec notes later, tag this as tank oriented rather than DPS oriented.

rank_notes.1: A small investment can help early survivability if you are leveling with a shield.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a defensive identity choice.

enhancement_guardian_totems.summary: Defensive and utility totem improvements. Useful in specific fights or PvP, not a default DPS throughput pick.
why_take: If your content demands higher value from specific defensive totems, this can be worth points.
Utility can be raid saving in niche scenarios where survival and control matter more than personal damage.
why_skip: For standard raid DPS, you usually prioritize talents that increase damage and consistency first.
Utility points often come only after core DPS packages are secured.
tips: Teach players to only value this when it changes outcomes, not because it looks generally useful.

rank_notes.1: One point can be a reasonable compromise if you need a small boost.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is for players intentionally optimizing defensive utility.

enhancement_thundering_strikes.summary: Your baseline crit engine. Enables Flurry uptime and scales every part of your damage kit.
why_take: Crit drives your melee throughput and improves how often Flurry stays active.
Crit amplifies weapon swing value by increasing the number of meaningful spikes from your swing events.
One of the best early investments per point on the path to mid tree power talents.
why_skip: Raid DPS does not skip it. The only time you would is if you are intentionally not progressing deeper into Enhancement.
tips: If your Flurry uptime feels poor, check hit and expertise first. Misses and dodges reduce crit opportunities.

rank_notes.1: Even the first point matters because it starts your Flurry engine earlier.
rank_notes.5: At max rank it is one of the highest value early tree investments.

common_mistakes: Judging this talent by crit alone. Its real value is how it enables other talents and smooths your damage profile.

enhancement_improved_ghost_wolf.summary: Mobility and quality of life. Strong for movement heavy content and PvP, not a primary raid DPS throughput talent.
why_take: Improves uptime on targets in movement heavy scenarios, which can indirectly increase damage.
Very useful in PvP and open world play where mobility drives outcomes.
why_skip: If your encounters are mostly stationary, the indirect damage gain is small compared to direct throughput talents.
Often trimmed when optimizing pure raid DPS progression to deeper tree power.
tips: If you add fight tags later, mark this as movement value rather than raw DPS.

rank_notes.1: A first point can improve feel immediately.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is best when mobility is a constant theme in your content.

enhancement_improved_lightning_shield.summary: Buffs Lightning Shield value. Small passive value for Enhancement, more noticeable in PvP and solo.
why_take: Adds passive pressure and value when Lightning Shield uptime is high.
Can be helpful in PvP where passive damage contributes to winning trades.
why_skip: In raids, Lightning Shield is not usually a top contributor compared to weapon driven damage and deeper Enhancement talents.
Points are often better spent reaching key core talents sooner.
tips: If you include a buff maintenance section, connect Lightning Shield uptime to the real value of this.

rank_notes.1: Small but consistent value.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is mainly for players who value passive pressure and frequent Lightning Shield uptime.

enhancement_enhancing_totems.summary: Totem buff amplifier. Adds both personal and group value and is commonly taken in raid builds.
why_take: Improves the strength of your key offensive totems, which increases your own damage and often your groups damage.
High value when your group consistently stays in range of your totems.
why_skip: If you are in content where totem coverage is inconsistent or the group is spread, real value drops.
In extremely selfish setups, some players may choose other points, but it is uncommon in raids.
tips: Totem value is uptime plus coverage. Encourage players to think about range discipline.

rank_notes.1: Early points are meaningful in groups that stay stacked.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is common for raid focused Enhancement.

enhancement_shamanistic_focus.summary: Shock mana relief. Key for shock focused play and for keeping rotation stable in long fights.
why_take: Reduces mana pressure from shocks which lets you maintain rotation longer.
Improves consistency for shock usage without forcing heavy intellect stacking.
why_skip: If you are playing a low shock style or your fights are short, the gain is less visible.
If your mana is already stable due to other factors, the point can move elsewhere.
tips: When people say a build is shock focused, this is one of the talents that enables it from a resource standpoint.
common_mistakes: Taking it and still going out of mana because of wasted shocks into bad timing windows or poor pacing.

enhancement_anticipation.summary: Defensive avoidance. More relevant for tanking and PvP than for pure raid DPS.
why_take: Useful for off tanking, solo survivability, and PvP where you are frequently targeted.
Can be taken in niche builds where survivability is more important than peak throughput.
why_skip: Avoidance does not raise your raid DPS output directly.
These points often block you from key Enhancement throughput later in the tree.
tips: If you provide a defensive variant build, include this there and keep it out of standard raid DPS paths.

rank_notes.1: Early points are a small buffer.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a defensive identity choice.

enhancement_flurry.summary: Core sustained DPS talent. Converts crit into attack speed, multiplying weapon damage and proc value.
why_take: Attack speed increases your white swings, which increases your total swing events and overall output.
More swing events improves consistency and increases the value of swing based effects.
Defining throughput lever for Enhancement in TBC.
why_skip: Raid DPS does not skip Flurry.
Only skipped in unusual non DPS setups.
tips: Do not only chase crit. You want enough hit and expertise so your swings actually land and can crit.
Flurry uptime is a strong practical metric to surface in your guide.

rank_notes.1: Point one is noticeable early.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is the target for serious PvE builds.

common_mistakes: Overvaluing other speed sources while undercapping hit, reducing real swing conversion.

enhancement_toughness.summary: Durability and control resistance style support. Often taken because it is efficient survivability that also improves uptime in messy fights.
why_take: Increases your durability so you can stay in and keep swinging.
Helps in movement control situations where slows and similar effects reduce uptime.
why_skip: If survivability is not a problem and you are optimizing pure throughput, you may trim defensive leaning points.
In tightly optimized raid DPS paths, some builds only take what they need to reach deeper power.
tips: If your damage drops because you are forced out or you die, survivability talents become indirect DPS gains.

rank_notes.1: A first point is a light survivability bump.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is more common in PvP or dangerous content.

enhancement_improved_weapon_totems.summary: Weapon totem amplifier. A common pick when your totems are contributing meaningful group value.
why_take: Directly boosts the value of weapon based totems, improving both personal and group benefit in range.
Fits weapon totem focused Enhancement variations.
why_skip: If your group is spread or weapon totem coverage is inconsistent, value can underperform other options.
In some builds, fire totem or shock focused points may win depending on encounter style.
tips: A future tool idea: estimate value by average number of players in range and expected uptime.

rank_notes.1: First point is often worth it in stable group stacking.
rank_notes.2: Max rank for weapon totem focused identity.

enhancement_spirit_weapons.summary: Gateway talent that unlocks Dual Wield. Also improves safety through threat and defensive value.
why_take: Required to progress into Dual Wield and deeper Enhancement.
Helps with threat control and adds defensive value that matters when you are ramping damage.
why_skip: If you are building Enhancement DPS and going dual wield, you do not skip it.
tips: If you include threat management notes, this is one of the talents that changes your pull ramp safety.

rank_notes.1: One point only, and it is a mandatory gate for standard DPS progression.

enhancement_elemental_weapons.summary: Enhances your weapon imbues and is a prerequisite for Stormstrike.
why_take: You need it to reach Stormstrike.
It improves the value of your imbues, which are central to Enhancement damage.
why_skip: You only skip if you are not taking Stormstrike, which is not standard for raid DPS.
tips: If you create an imbue section, link it back to this talent because it is part of the imbue scaling story.

rank_notes.1: Early points matter because imbues are always active.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is standard on the path to Stormstrike.

enhancement_mental_quickness.summary: Hybrid scaling engine. Converts your melee power into stronger instant spell components and helps rotation stability.
why_take: Improves the damage contribution of shocks and other instant spell based elements of your kit.
Often improves mana efficiency and makes shock usage feel more sustainable.
why_skip: If you are playing a very low shock style, the hybrid value is lower.
Still usually taken because it sits on the standard path to deeper Enhancement power.
tips: This is a key bridge talent for explaining why Enhancement cares about certain spell oriented stats in specific builds.

rank_notes.1: The first point starts the scaling relationship.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is common for raid DPS builds.

enhancement_weapon_mastery.summary: Consistency and expertise style payoff. Increases the chance your melee events actually connect, which stabilizes your whole kit.
why_take: Fewer dodges and parries means more real swing events turning into real damage.
Consistency is a multiplier for everything else you stack, including crit and attack speed.
why_skip: It is rarely skipped in serious raid DPS because consistency is too valuable.
tips: When teaching caps, explain that avoiding failed melee events is often more important than small theoretical gains.

rank_notes.1: Early points can noticeably reduce frustrating failure streaks.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is standard for PvE DPS.

common_mistakes: Chasing more crit while ignoring consistency talents and caps, then blaming RNG.

enhancement_dual_wield.summary: Defines the spec for PvE DPS. Enables off hand swings and unlocks Dual Wield Specialization.
why_take: Massively increases your number of swing events, which drives most Enhancement scaling.
Opens access to further dual wield throughput talents.
why_skip: You do not skip in PvE DPS.
Only skipped in niche defensive or leveling experiments.
tips: Dual wield changes priorities. Hit and expertise become more important because you now have more swing events that can fail.

rank_notes.1: One point only, and it changes your whole gameplay model.

enhancement_dual_wield_specialization.summary: Turns Dual Wield from enabled to effective. Major throughput increase per point.
why_take: Improves off hand contribution which is a large portion of your total swing count.
More landed swings increases consistency and makes your damage profile smoother.
why_skip: PvE DPS does not skip it once you take Dual Wield.
tips: This is an ideal place to explain why hit and expertise are consistency multipliers, not just small stats.

rank_notes.1: First point is immediately noticeable.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is standard for raid DPS.

enhancement_stormstrike.summary: Signature button. Strong weapon based hit that defines burst windows and rotation structure.
why_take: Adds a reliable on demand weapon based damage event.
Creates a clear rotation anchor point and burst planning window.
why_skip: You generally do not skip Stormstrike for raid DPS.
Only skipped in unusual builds that are not playing as a DPS spec.
tips: If you teach swing syncing and staggering, include notes on how to avoid damaging your swing plan when pressing major buttons.
common_mistakes: Pressing it on cooldown with no regard for swing planning when the player is actively training swing timing.

rank_notes.1: One point only, and it is a defining Enhancement milestone.

enhancement_unleashed_rage.summary: Raid value talent. Strong personal gain plus group benefit, one of the reasons Enhancement is invited.
why_take: Improves your own throughput while also contributing meaningful group value.
Rewards consistent crit and stable uptime, reinforcing good fundamentals.
why_skip: Skipping it is basically never correct for PvE DPS.
If you cannot reach it, you are likely over investing in Elemental or Restoration and sacrificing core Enhancement identity.
tips: If you include raid contribution notes, call out this talent as a major reason Enhancement brings value beyond personal damage.

rank_notes.1: Early points already add raid value, but you usually commit fully.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is standard for raid builds.

enhancement_shamanistic_rage.summary: Resource and survivability cooldown. Stabilizes mana and helps you recover when pacing goes wrong.
why_take: Solves meaningful mana stress in long fights so you can keep shocking and maintain your plan.
Provides a safety tool that can prevent rotation collapse after mistakes or unexpected damage.
why_skip: In real raid DPS builds you do not skip it.
If you are not reaching it, you are investing too much outside Enhancement and giving up core stability.
tips: Add encounter notes later for common moments where players press it too late and lose value.

rank_notes.1: One point only, and it is a major stability milestone.

restoration_improved_healing_wave.summary: Healing cast speed support. Primarily Restoration throughput, not a standard Enhancement choice.
why_take: Only taken if you are building a hybrid that must provide meaningful cast healing.
why_skip: Enhancement raid DPS points are extremely valuable and should not be diverted into pure healing speed unless the role demands it.
Going deep Restoration for healing usually costs Unleashed Rage and Shamanistic Rage, which are core Enhancement value.
tips: If you include a hybrid appendix, clarify that this is a role choice, not an optimization for Enhancement DPS.

rank_notes.1: Minor unless you are actively casting Healing Wave.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is Restoration identity.

restoration_tidal_focus.summary: Healing mana efficiency. Restoration oriented and not a standard Enhancement investment.
why_take: Only if your role requires frequent healing casts and you need efficiency.
why_skip: Does not increase Enhancement damage or raid buffs.
Deep Restoration investment competes with the Enhancement talents that define your spec value.
tips: For Enhancement context, place this under off role notes only.

rank_notes.1: Value depends on how often you cast heals.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is for dedicated healers.

restoration_improved_reincarnation.summary: Reincarnation quality and reliability. Utility talent that can matter on progression, but not a throughput pick.
why_take: If you are learning content and wipes are common, improved reincarnation can be practical value.
Useful in PvP and open world where self recovery matters.
why_skip: Does not increase your damage output.
If points are tight, you normally protect core Enhancement throughput first.
tips: Treat this as utility insurance. It is valuable when it saves attempts, not when judging raw DPS.

rank_notes.1: A small investment can be enough to get the utility you want.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is for players who value the safety consistently.

restoration_ancestral_healing.summary: Healing crit defensive buff support. Restoration focused, not an Enhancement DPS tool.
why_take: Only if you are acting in a meaningful healing capacity where crit heals are common.
why_skip: Enhancement does not want to spend points on healing crit side effects for raid DPS.
Deep Restoration costs core Enhancement raid value and personal output.
tips: If included, label as healer oriented only.

rank_notes.1: Value depends on healing crit frequency.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a healer commitment.

restoration_totemic_focus.summary: Sub resto efficiency pick. Lowers totem cost, supporting long fights and frequent refresh patterns.
why_take: If you maintain multiple totems for long fights, cost adds up and this reduces that burden.
Supports totem heavy play styles, including frequent updates for coverage.
why_skip: If fights are short or you are not refreshing often, payoff is smaller.
If you must protect deep Enhancement talents, you keep sub resto shallow and efficient.
tips: This is one of the best sub resto fillers because it provides practical quality and stability without changing your rotation.

rank_notes.1: A first point is already noticeable on long sessions.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is common in sub resto packages that commit for efficiency.

restoration_natures_guidance.summary: Consistency support through hit for both melee and spells. A cornerstone of sub resto Enhancement builds.
why_take: Improves consistency. Landing key abilities matters more than small theoretical gains when you are below caps.
Smooths both melee and shock reliability, which stabilizes damage and reduces dead windows.
why_skip: If your gear already covers hit needs comfortably, value is lower, but still often competitive.
If you are pushing a sub Elemental concept instead, you may not have points for both.
tips: Pair this directly with your hit cap explanation. Consistency comes first, then throughput.

rank_notes.1: Even one point can reduce early gearing frustration.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is common in sub resto packages.

restoration_healing_focus.summary: Pushback protection for healing casts. Not relevant for Enhancement DPS unless you are acting as a hybrid healer.
why_take: If your role requires cast healing while under pressure, this can increase your effective healing output.
why_skip: Enhancement raid DPS does not want to allocate points to healing cast stability.
Depth into Restoration for this purpose costs key Enhancement talents.
tips: If you include hybrid notes, make the role tradeoff explicit.

rank_notes.1: Minor unless you frequently cast heals under pressure.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a healer play pattern choice.

restoration_totemic_mastery.summary: Totem radius extension. Quality of life that can become real raid value on movement and spread fights.
why_take: In fights where the group spreads or moves, extra radius can translate into real uptime.
Supports a totem coverage oriented Enhancement approach, especially when positioning is imperfect.
why_skip: If your group stacks tightly and totem placement is easy, this is more convenience than power.
If points are tight, Nature's Guidance and Totemic Focus usually provide more direct value.
tips: Great talent to teach the concept of totem coverage as a real performance driver.

rank_notes.1: One point is all you need if you take it.

restoration_healing_grace.summary: Healing threat reduction. Restoration specific and not relevant to Enhancement DPS.
why_take: Only for builds that regularly heal in group content where healing threat matters.
why_skip: No DPS gain and rarely a role requirement for Enhancement.
Deep Restoration investment costs core Enhancement throughput and raid value.
tips: Keep this as completeness only in an Enhancement guide.

rank_notes.1: Value depends entirely on healing role frequency.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is for dedicated healers.

restoration_restorative_totems.summary: Improves restorative totems. Strong for Restoration support, but usually too deep for Enhancement DPS priorities.
why_take: If your group relies heavily on restorative totems for sustain and you are playing a support leaning role.
why_skip: Depth conflicts with core Enhancement endpoints like Unleashed Rage and Shamanistic Rage.
Enhancement usually wants sub resto only for efficient utility and consistency, not deep healing throughput.
tips: If you include it, call out that it is beyond normal Enhancement sub spec depth.

rank_notes.1: Early points are only meaningful if your restorative totems are a constant factor.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a Restoration identity choice.

restoration_tidal_mastery.summary: Healing crit support. Restoration throughput, not Enhancement DPS.
why_take: If you are a healer or hybrid healer and crit healing is part of your plan.
why_skip: No Enhancement DPS payoff and too deep for normal sub resto packages.
Opportunity cost against core Enhancement talents is too high.
tips: In an Enhancement guide, treat this as off role only.

rank_notes.1: Value depends on healing crit relevance.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is for dedicated healers.

restoration_healing_way.summary: Healing Wave synergy talent. Restoration oriented, not Enhancement DPS.
why_take: Only if you are repeatedly casting Healing Wave as part of a healing role.
why_skip: Does not support Enhancement damage or raid buffs.
Depth competes with Enhancement milestones.
tips: If you include hybrid builds, make sure the player understands the role change.

rank_notes.1: Minor unless Healing Wave is a main spell.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is for healing patterns.

restoration_natures_swiftness.summary: Emergency instant cast utility. Valuable in PvP and hybrid support, but too deep for standard Enhancement raid DPS.
why_take: Provides a clutch emergency tool that can save a pull or secure a PvP moment.
Useful if your group relies on you for occasional critical saves.
why_skip: Depth is the primary problem. Reaching it usually forces you to give up core Enhancement raid value and stability.
If you are focused on raid DPS, you generally cannot afford this much Restoration investment.
tips: If included, position it as a role and responsibility choice, not a throughput optimization.

rank_notes.1: One point only, but the depth defines the build.

restoration_focused_mind.summary: Casting stability and efficiency style support for healers. Not part of normal Enhancement DPS planning.
why_take: Only if you are frequently casting heals under disruption and need more reliability.
why_skip: Too deep for Enhancement sub resto and not tied to your weapon based damage plan.
Opportunity cost against core Enhancement talents is significant.
tips: Keep this under healer or hybrid notes only.

rank_notes.1: Value depends on how often your healing casts are disrupted.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is a healer commitment.

restoration_purification.summary: Healing throughput amplifier. Restoration only from an Enhancement perspective.
why_take: If you are a healer or your role demands strong healing output.
why_skip: Enhancement raid DPS does not gain value here and the depth is incompatible with standard Enhancement endpoints.
tips: If shown, label clearly as Restoration throughput.

rank_notes.1: Early points only matter if you are healing frequently.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is for dedicated healers.

restoration_mana_tide_totem.summary: Major mana support cooldown for groups. Powerful, but deep Restoration makes it a different spec identity.
why_take: If your primary responsibility is supporting caster mana as a Restoration leaning build.
why_skip: Deep Restoration conflicts with Enhancement DPS identity and core raid value talents.
If you want to play Enhancement DPS, you generally cannot justify this depth.
tips: Call out clearly that taking this effectively shifts your build away from Enhancement DPS priorities.

rank_notes.1: One point only, but the depth is the defining cost.

restoration_natures_guardian.summary: Defensive safety net. Useful in PvP and survival focused play, but too deep for standard Enhancement raid DPS.
why_take: If survivability is a consistent limiter and you are willing to trade deep Enhancement throughput for safety.
why_skip: Depth competes with Enhancement endpoints and raid value.
If you are optimizing damage and contribution, you normally solve survival with play and gear first.
tips: Frame as a survival insurance talent, not as a damage tool.

rank_notes.1: Small early value if you are frequently under threat.
rank_notes.5: Max rank is a defensive identity decision.

restoration_natures_blessing.summary: Healing scaling support. Restoration throughput oriented and not part of Enhancement DPS planning.
why_take: Only if you are a healer or hybrid healer where improving heals is a primary goal.
why_skip: Too deep for Enhancement, and does not support your weapon based damage plan.
Opportunity cost against Enhancement raid value is too high.
tips: Treat this as Restoration only in an Enhancement guide.

rank_notes.1: Value depends on healing role frequency.
rank_notes.3: Max rank is for dedicated healers.

restoration_improved_chain_heal.summary: Chain Heal specialization. Restoration throughput, not Enhancement DPS.
why_take: If you are assigned to Chain Heal heavy raid healing.
why_skip: Not relevant to Enhancement damage or raid buff contribution.
Depth is incompatible with standard Enhancement endpoints.
tips: Keep as completeness only for Enhancement focused documentation.

rank_notes.1: Minor unless Chain Heal is a primary spell.
rank_notes.2: Max rank is for dedicated Chain Heal roles.

restoration_earth_shield.summary: Deep Restoration signature tool. Powerful in its role, but represents a different spec identity than Enhancement DPS.
why_take: If you are functioning as a Restoration support role or PvP build that values Earth Shield highly.
why_skip: Depth into Restoration prevents you from taking core Enhancement talents that define your raid DPS and raid value.
If you are playing Enhancement, you typically do not pursue Earth Shield in a raid DPS planner.
tips: Call out clearly that reaching this changes your role expectations.

rank_notes.1: One point only, but the depth is the real trade.
